image.altText: A worker checks cable connection on a solar panel at a solar farm

props.synopsis: While experts weigh in on the great energy debate, one builder says the industry has already made up its mind.

title.children: In the debate between renewables and nuclear, some say it's 'game over'

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: Angus Ross Robertson, 24, was charged with two counts of rape and two acts of indecency on the woman, who was a fellow cadet.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping fellow ADFA cadet

image.altText: A small white fluffy glider with prominent ears, wide eyes and a little button nose peeks out of hole in a tree at night

props.synopsis: The South East Forest Rescue group alleged the Forestry Corporation of NSW did not conduct a broad area habitat search for features of habitat for three species of glider in a northern New South Wales forest.

title.children: High Court verdict provides 'hope amid an escalating extinction crisis'

image.altText: The exterior of a modern concrete building with a sign out front reading "High Court of Australia".

props.synopsis: Convicted killer Rodney Cherry loses his High Court bid for freedom, after the court refuses to overturn Queensland's no body no parole law.

title.children: Convicted killer Rodney Cherry loses appeal for freedom

image.altText: A box and vial of the Measles, Mumps, Rubella Virus Vaccine at a vaccine clinic.

props.synopsis: Adults can catch and spread the disease, especially if they are under-vaccinated â€” a category many Australians might find themselves in. Here's what you need to know about getting fully vaccinated against measles.

title.children: Am I protected against measles? Your vaccine questions answered

image.altText: Andrew Laming

props.synopsis: Former Liberal MP Andrew Laming is disputing a fine he has been handed over content he posted online in the lead-up to the 2019 election that did not contain the required authorisations.

title.children: Former MP to appeal in High Court against fine for electoral law breaches

image.altText: A single-story house with a large gum tree branch fallen on the roof, causing damage.

props.synopsis:
After a tree branch that Canberra resident Terrylea Reynolds had repeatedly reported as being dangerous fell on her house, she's hopeful a law update will help stop the same thing happening to others.

Â

title.children: Terrylea reported a concerning tree. Then its branch fell on her house

image.altText: A man in handcuffs, surrounded by police, is led into the back of a police vehicle.

props.synopsis: Police say it's a miracle no one was injured during the cross-border chase. The driver later tested positive to drugs, with police finding weapons in his car.

title.children: Police pursuit ends as driver jumps into Lake Burley Griffin

image.altText: A market board, blurred, showing most stock prices in the red as the ASX slumps.

props.synopsis: Australian shares give back most of the previous session's gains, with the All Ords dropping 1.9pc as China reacts to Donald Trump's tariffs coming into force.

title.children: Nearly $50b wiped off ASX as Trump tariffs take full effect

image.altText: A 400-ounce shiny gold bar on display.

props.synopsis: While global markets have been reeling from Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, gold prices remain near record highs. Bullion is currently exempt from the US import charges, as central banks including the Federal Reserve drive demand.

title.children: Why gold has slipped during market rout despite safe-haven status

image.altText: Peter Dutton in hi-vis and a hard hat walks up stairs in a factory.

props.synopsis: Modelling has found the opposition's flagship gas reservation policy may bring down household electricity bills by "around 3 per cent" next year, meaning a saving of roughly $50 to $70 a year for most families.

title.children: Coalition gives two different timelines for bill savings from gas plan

image.altText: A young woman with long hair and glasses looks off into the distance

props.synopsis: Domestic, family and sexual violence support services say more funding is needed to meet a surge in demand.

title.children: What's on offer for domestic violence prevention this election?

image.altText: How far will Australian dollar fall

props.synopsis: The Australian dollar has fallen to its lowest level against the greenback since the height of the pandemic. Lower commodity prices and expectations the Reserve Bank will need to aggressively cut interest rates are devaluing the local currency.

title.children: Australian dollar dives as analysts warn of potential 'mayhem'

image.altText: Urvi stand up hero

props.synopsis: All parents want what's best for their children, but what if what your child wants is completely at odds with your ambitions for them? Indian-born comedian Urvi Majumdar and her father Bhaskar speak about navigating her "uncomfortable" choice to pursue a career in comedy.

title.children: 'Realist' Bhaskar on daughter Urvi's 'uncomfortable' career choice

image.altText: Elon Musk sits in the Oval Office wearing a red baseball cap that says: "Trump was right about everything"

props.synopsis: Elon Musk calls Donald Trump's top trade adviser a "moron", escalating tensions over tariffs within the US president's inner sanctum, as some White House officials indicate deals could be on the table.

title.children: Musk calls Trump adviser 'dumber than bricks' as tariff blowback escalates

image.altText: Man with his arm up and hand on microphone speaking.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's trade chief Jamieson Greer has defended the United States's 10 per cent tariff on Australia regardless of the countries' free trade agreement, claiming Australia has banned US beef and pork.

title.children: Trump's trade chief says US 'should be running up the score on Australia'

image.altText: The wreckage of a helicopter on a sand bank with emergency services standing nearby

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Burea report has found a series of safety issues contributed to the crash that killed four people and injured nine others in 2023.

title.children: 'Limited opportunities' for pilots to detect each other before deadly Sea World crash

image.altText: Sarah McBride with her daughter conceived through IVF

props.synopsis: Last week the federal health department accepted an expanded definition of infertility that would allow LGBTIQ+ couples and single people like Sarah McBride to be able to access Medicare rebates for assisted reproductive technology. Â

title.children: 'Socially infertile' people like Sarah can now access Medicare rebates

image.altText: The two divers in the water after being spotted by crew members on board Rottnest Fast Ferries.

props.synopsis: Two brothers who were left behind in the ocean during a diving expedition off the Perth coast say they feared they wouldn't survive the ordeal.

title.children: 'Treated it like a joke': Divers left behind off Perth coast furious at company

image.altText: A photo of a child in an album.

props.synopsis: After a scathing report into South Korea's decades-long baby export program, Australians have launched a petition urging the federal government to investigate the adoptions of about 3,600 children since 1978.

title.children: Australian adoptees call for inquiry in wake of Korean adoptions scandal

image.altText: A woman wearing a sports uniform jacket points towards the stadium seats behind her.

props.synopsis: While the Matildas are still looking for their long-term head coach, assistant Melissa Andreatta signs on to coach Scotland's national women's team.

title.children: As Matildas coach search goes on, Scotland poaches top assistant

image.altText: Kim Birrell, Samantha Stosur and Maya Joint sit together at a press conference at the Billie Jean King Cup.

props.synopsis: Australia starts its 2025 Billie Jean King Cup campaign in Brisbane against a Kazakhstan team featuring two WTA top-30 players, including 2022 Wimbledon winner Elena Rybakina.

title.children: Australia trying to add to history of 'enormous upsets' at BJK Cup

image.altText: A group of indigenous people standing at the front of the High Court

props.synopsis: A group of native title owners from South Australia's far north have welcomed a win over a small parcel of land near Oodnadatta.Â

title.children: Native title owners welcome High Court win

image.altText: Blurred photo of mulitple people standing around outside businesses on a street.

props.synopsis: An NT Supreme Court judge has suspended the sentence of a woman who pleaded guilty to a violent crime against a teenage girl, citing "disgusting" and "inhuman" conditions at the Alice Springs watch house.

title.children: Judge cites 'inhuman' lock-up conditions in attacker's suspended sentence

image.altText: a sign which reads, "We Stand with AP" inside the White House

props.synopsis: The ban came after the news agency said it would continue using the name Gulf of Mexico, which prompted President Trump to say he would "keep them out until such time as they agree it's the Gulf of America."

title.children: Judge orders AP's return to White House. Why did Trump ban them?

image.altText: Peter Navarro walking on the street with a smile

props.synopsis: A year ago, Peter Navarro was serving time in a Miami prison. Today, he's credited with having influence over the US president's tariff plans.

title.children: 'Boys will be boys': Who is the Trump adviser feuding with Elon Musk?

image.altText: a composite image of two boys, seen from behind

props.synopsis: Years after two brothers with disabilities were found naked and locked in a room in a Brisbane home, the Queensland Education department has been urged to make sure suspicions of harm are "appropriately recorded".

title.children: Call for better reporting after brothers found naked and malnourished

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Angus Taylor behind a podium.

props.synopsis: Government administration experts have warned that while it is possible to shrink the public service through natural attrition, it would be difficult to avoid impacting service delivery.

title.children: Most public service attrition overlaps with service delivery roles

image.altText: Aerial view of a stadium.

props.synopsis: "You pack 'em up in a box. They come out in a box." Senator Jacqui Lambie thinks she's found a "best of both worlds" solution to Tasmania's stadium dilemma.

title.children: Jacqui Lambie floats 'tent-like' roof fix for AFL stadium row

image.altText: Close up of a brunette young woman wearing a stack of necklaces in a sandy location.

props.synopsis: Though Aimee Lou Wood and Walton Goggins are far from unattractive, they both possess features that stand out in Hollywood's often homogenous landscape.

title.children: The White Lotus is changing the face (and smile) of Hollywood

image.altText: orcas in the ocean and birds flying above the water

props.synopsis: Scientists and tourists are left in awe by a rare and dramatic encounter off the state's south coast.

title.children: Marine biologist and tourists in awe as 60 orcas attack blue whale

image.altText: A woman in a suit jacket has a guitar around her neck and points towards the man next to her, singing dramatically in glasses.

props.synopsis: A collaboration between an EGOT and an Americana trailblazer should be a home run, but Who Believes in Angels? is a sanitised extravaganza.

title.children: Elton John and Brandi Carlile go too big and too clean on new album

image.altText: Composite image of Charles Dance, Thom Yorke, and Julianne Moore on various red carpets

props.synopsis: Thousands of creatives have signed the petition which calls for an end to the unlicensed use of creative work to train generative AI models.

title.children: Statement against AI training passes 50,000 signatures

image.altText: Cheng Chau Brisbane casino

props.synopsis: Star and its Chinese partner both did business with the disgraced Suncity junket. It is set to cost one of them a share in Australia's most expensive casino.

title.children: Hidden ties to crime figure no barrier for Brisbane casino takeover

image.altText: A four-year-old boy wearing shorts and a t-shirt sits on the grass with a broad smile on his face.

props.synopsis: The mother of a boy who is deafblind is frustrated after being told her son will not have the one-on-one assistance he needs to understand lessons in his preferred setting.

title.children: Parents 'confused and baffled' by school inclusion policies
